definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through

sentences.english: Surrounded by layers of loneliness, I have no strength out of the trap.
sentences.chinese: 寂寞层层包围，我再也没有力气走出这片重围。

sentences.english: A large number of reporters waiting outside the hospital didi, discharge ShangHeng belt she rushed out of the trap.
sentences.chinese: 大批记者在医院外等候迪迪出院，尚恒带她冲出重围。

sentences.english: Buy the right car now, and you'll have no trouble outrunning the zombie apocalypse when it comes.
sentences.chinese: 趁现在买辆好车，好在僵尸来袭时冲出重围。

sentences.english: Buy the right car now, and you’ll have no trouble outrunning the zombie apocalypse when it comes.
sentences.chinese: 趁现在买辆好车，好在僵尸来袭时冲出重围。

sentences.english: When we awake, we find ourselves at foreign land, and are besieged.
sentences.chinese: 当意识觉醒时，却发现自己身首异处，身陷重围。

definition: to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
desperate getaway (from a battlefield)/to cut a bloody path out of a battlefield
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to fight with all one's might
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
